assassin.name: Assassin (Decadent, Unique)
assassin.description: Your first attack against an unaware target is an automatic hit that deals 2d6 + your level points of damage.
assassin.label: Assassin

berserker.name: Berserker (Barbarian, Unique)
berserker.description: When you go berserk add a d6 to the damage you deal. Damage you receive is divided by 2. Your rage stops when you roll a 1 on the d6. You need a long rest to be able to go berserk again.
berserker.label: Berserker

bodyguard.name: Bodyguard (Civilized)
bodyguard.description: If you use an action to protect a Close character during your turn, you absorb any damage from attacks against them, but you divide it by two (rounding up).
bodyguard.label: Bodyguard

bookworm.name: Bookworm (Civilized)
bookworm.description: You can substitute any attribute test with an INT test (explain how and why your knowledge helps you). Replenishes after a long rest.
bookworm.label: Bookworm

changeling.name: Changeling (Decadent)
changeling.description: You were abducted as a baby and raised by very different folk. Choose two faerie ties.
changeling.label: Changeling

chieftain.name: Chieftain (Barbarian)
chieftain.description: You can use Strength instead of Charisma when trying to intimidate someone.
chieftain.label: Chieftain

diplomat.name: Diplomat (Civilized)
diplomat.description: You know two additional languages and can make yourself understood by anyone willing to do so. If all you do is talk you can act first at the beginning of any combat Turn.
diplomat.label: Diplomat

forbidden_knowledge.name: Forbidden Knowledge (Decadent)
forbidden_knowledge.description: You start the game with 4 randomly selected spells.
forbidden_knowledge.label: Forbidden Knowledge

herbalist.name: Herbalist (Barbarian)
herbalist.description: You can create d6 doses of healing balms (restores d6 HP + level each), hallucinogenic drugs or poisons (d6 damage per dose). You need a long rest in a natural environment to replenish it.
herbalist.label: Herbalist

hunter.name: Hunter (Barbarian)
hunter.description: In combat your first arrow always hits, add your level to the damage.
hunter.label: Hunter

inventor.name: Inventor (Civilized, Unique)
inventor.description: You know how to build 2 scientific marvels.
inventor.label: Inventor

legionnaire.name: Legionnaire (Civilized)
legionnaire.description: You are used to fighting in groups. Three times per session, a Nearby ally can re-roll a failed dodge, parry or attack roll.
legionnaire.label: Legionnaire

pit_fighter.name: Pit Fighter (Decadent)
pit_fighter.description: Your unarmed damage is equal to your armed damage.
pit_fighter.label: Pit Fighter

raider.name: Raider (Barbarian)
raider.description: When you get a critical success on an Attack roll you inflict damage equal to your Strength score (no need to roll the damage).
raider.label: Raider

scout.name: Scout (Barbarian)
scout.description: You get Advantage on your initiative rolls.
scout.label: Scout

shaman.name: Shaman (Barbarian)
shaman.description: You have made a pact with two spirits.
shaman.label: Shaman

sophist.name: Sophist (Civilized)
sophist.description: You can make someone believe a blatant lie if you succeed at a CHA test. The 'effect' lasts one hour.
sophist.label: Sophist

storyteller.name: Storyteller (Barbarian)
storyteller.description: You always know d4 interesting things about objects, places or people (one roll per session). While you tell a story, your audience doesn't notice what happens Nearby.
storyteller.label: Storyteller

street_urchin.name: Street Urchin (Civilized)
street_urchin.description: Get Advantage on actions involving stealth, pick-pocketing, eavesdropping and streetwise.
street_urchin.label: Street Urchin

surgeon.name: Surgeon (Civilized)
surgeon.description: Make an INT test when taking care of someone who has fallen to 0 HP. They roll a d4 on the Helpless table instead of a d6 if you succeed.
surgeon.label: Surgeon

survivor.name: Survivor (Barbarian)
survivor.description: It takes you 1d6 minutes to find something that can be used as a knife or club.
survivor.label: Survivor

swordmaster.name: Swordmaster (Civilized)
swordmaster.description: You can use DEX instead of STR when making a melee attack with one-handed bladed weapons.
swordmaster.label: Swordmaster

vicious.name: Vicious (Decadent)
vicious.description: Your damage die is now d8 (d6 unarmed).
vicious.label: Vicious

warlock.name: Warlock (Decadent)
warlock.description: You have a pact with two demons.
warlock.label: Warlock

births.1: ...in a jeweled tower of a corrupt empire
births.3: ...in a brothel in the City Of Thieves
births.5: ...in the harsh lands of a desert tribe
births.6: ...in a secret society hideout in the Far East
births.8: ...among your Pict brothers and sisters after a raid
births.9: ...aboard a longship of the Northern raiders
births.10: ...in the last city of a dying species
births.11: ...while the rest of the Iron Horde was attacking a caravan
births.12: ...in an isolated farm on the frontier
births.13: ...in a fortress burned by your family enemies
births.14: ...in the ruins of a crystal palace
births.15: ...in the middle of a mercenary camp
births.16: ...on a tropical island just before it sank
births.17: ...in an asylum deep within the Forbidden City
births.18: ...inside a wicker man about to be burned
births.19: ...at the top of a black pyramid
births.20: ...in a hurricane summoned by your mother

barbarian.2: ...on an island just before the invaders came.
barbarian.4: ...in an invading army's camp before you were kidnapped
barbarian.5: ...under the harsh sun, in the territory of a desert tribe.
barbarian.6: ...in the hut of a banished druid.
barbarian.7: ...in a stone circle shunned by your people
barbarian.8: ...among your Pict brothers and sisters after a bloody battle.
barbarian.9: ...aboard a longship filled with Norther raiders.
barbarian.10: ...nine months after a foreign mercenary married your mother.
barbarian.11: ...while the rest of the Iron Horde was attacking a caravan.
barbarian.12: ...in a civilized kingdom, but you were traded as a hostage.
barbarian.13: ...in a cave network ruled by strange insectoid creatures.
barbarian.14: ...in a palace, soon after raided by your adoptive tribe.
barbarian.15: ...on the night your clan burned the Empire's capital.
barbarian.16: ...in a forest clearing, denounced by the druids as a dark omen.
barbarian.17: ...on the last ship of a seafaring clan.
barbarian.18: ...inside a wicker statue about to be burned.
barbarian.19: ...on the foreign ship bringing your family back home.
barbarian.20: ...in the middle of a battle against your conquerors.

civilized.3: ...aboard a plague ship, somehow the only survivor.
civilized.5: ...during an expedition searching for a mythical city.
civilized.6: ...on the street, as your family was fleeing revolutionary forces.
civilized.7: ...in a foreign land after your parent's ship got wrecked.
civilized.8: ...inside an invocation pentacle, near the sorcerer's body.
civilized.9: ...on a prison island where the monarch's political opponents are sent.
civilized.10: ...on the day the king was beheaded by your father.
civilized.11: ...aboard a ship sent to find a new maritime route.
civilized.12: ...in the military academy where your parents where teaching.
civilized.13: ...in a fortress later burned by your family's enemies.
civilized.14: ...in the biggest mansion of the city's merchant quarter.
civilized.15: ...in the middle of a mercenary camp.
civilized.17: ...in the dilapidated manor of your ruined family.
civilized.18: ...in an isolated farm on the frontier.
civilized.19: ...in the richest palace of the Caliphate.
civilized.20: ...in the hideout for the assassin's guild.

decadent.1: ...in a jewelled tower, symbol of a corrupt empire.
decadent.2: ...in the barracks of the slave soldiers.
decadent.3: ...in a disreputable borthel of the City Of Thieves.
decadent.4: ...in the poppy fields owned by the Court's greatest sorcerer.
decadent.5: ...in the necropolis where you were raised by ghosts.
decadent.6: ...in a meuseum, as part of the permanent exhibition.
decadent.7: ...in the ruins of a crystal palace.
decadent.8: ...inside a monstrous creature killed by your adoptive parents.
decadent.9: ...as a vessel for the soul of a dying noble. The ritual failed.
decadent.10: ...in the last city of a dying species.
decadent.11: ...covered with the blood of your own people after a failed invocation.
decadent.13: ...in the servants quarters of a vampire's tower.
decadent.14: ...below the Empress's palace, among her slaves.
decadent.15: ...in the dessicated gardens of a dying desert city.
decadent.16: ...on a tropical island, just as it was beginning to sink.
decadent.17: ...in an asylum deep within the Forbidden City.
decadent.18: ...in the laboratory of the alchemist that your called father.
decadent.19: ...at the top of a pyramid of red obsidian.
decadent.20: ...in a hurrican summoned by your mother.

blurbs.base_attributes: The values below are the base values for your attributes. These will be altered by your backgrounds to generate your actual attribute values. Changes to your attribute values and backgrounds here will update your actual attribute values.
blurbs.defend_fumble: Your armour does not protect you from the damage of this attack!
blurbs.random_generation: By clicking on the button below you'll randomly generate all details for your character according to the default rules of the system. Note that doing this will overwrite your current character settings - you have been warned!
blurbs.stories: Stories dictate your level. The more stories you've survived the higher your will be in level. The list below records the stories you've been part of and what level that makes you. Remember to also select your gifts and attribute bonuses as you attain the appropriate level.

actors.notFound: Unable to locate the required actor.

attributes.invalid: Actor attribute setting not found. This is a bug!
attributes.missing: Element attribute setting not found on element. This is a bug!
attributes.notFound: Unable to locate a valid attribute setting for attribute die roll.

items.notFound: Unable to locate the specified item.

owned.notFound: Unable to locate the item and/or it's owner.
owned.unavailable: Unable to reset item usage die as the current quantity is zero.

custom.inactive: You must activate custom character origins in the game settings to make use of these.

spells.notFound: Unable to locate the specified spell.

usageDie.exhausted: Unable to make usage die roll as the usage die is currently exhausted.
usageDie.notFound: Unable to locate the item usage die details.

weapons.notFound: Unable to locate the specified weapon.
weapons.unowned: The weapon specified isn't owned and cannot be used.

titles.calculatedAttribute: Consult the Basics tab to alter your attributes.

blurbs.callFailure: The spirit chooses to ignore the call!
blurbs.castFumble: Spell fails catastrophically (roll on the Torn Veil table).
blurbs.callSuccess: The spirit responds to the call!
blurbs.castFailure: But the spell fizzles and fails!
blurbs.castSuccess: And spell casting is a success!
blurbs.summonFailure: The demon chooses to ignore the summoning!
blurbs.summonFumble: The demon is angered by the summoning (roll on the Demon's Revenge table)!

demons.summonFumbled: Summoning of the %NAME% demon was unsuccessful. Roll on the %TABLE% table.
demons.summonSuccessful: Summoning of the %NAME% demon was successful.
demons.unavailable: Summoning of the %NAME% demon failed - Doom die is exhausted!

doom.downgraded: Doom die for %NAME% has been downgraded to %DIE%.
doom.exhausted: Unable to roll doom for %NAME% as their doom die is exhausted!

rests.longRest: The benefits of a long rest have been applied to %NAME%.
rests.shortRest: The benefits of a short rest have been applied to %NAME%.

spells.castFumbled: Casting of the %NAME% spelled failed badly. Roll on the %TABLE% table!
spells.castSuccessful: Casting of the %NAME% spell was successful.

spirits.unavailable: Summoning of the %NAME% spirit failed - Doom die is exhausted!
spirits.summonFailed: Summoning of the %NAME% spirit failed - Doom is now exhausted.
spirits.summonSuccessful: Your summoning of the %NAME% spirit was successful.

customOrigins.blurb: Activate custom character origins. Don't toggle this if you already have characters created as this will break things!
customOrigins.title: Custom Character Origins
